newsitem.title: CANADA: Canadian actor Graham Greene in brush with police.
newsitem.headline: Canadian actor Graham Greene in brush with police.

text.p: Canadian actor Graham Greene, an Oscar nominee for his role in "Dances With Wolves", was in a hospital on Friday after a standoff with police in which he threatened to kill himself, authorities said.
Police said no charges would be laid against Greene since no weapons were involved in the incident on Thursday, which ended peacefully after the actor agreed to a psychiatric assessment.

"The police conversed with (Greene) over several hours at which time the matter was resolved without incident," York Regional Police Sgt. John Sheldon said in a phone interview. "(He) was taken to York County Hospital where he was admitted for psychiatric assessment."
Sheldon said Greene had been "despondent over matters involving family and friends."
Police surrounded Greene's house in Georgina, a town about 65 km (40 miles) north of Toronto, after reports that the actor had guns in the house and was suicidal.
Greene was alone in the house during the standoff.
His agent, Celia Chassels, declined to comment on the incident.

The actor, best-known for portraying native North Americans in films, television and on stage, was nominated for a best supporting actor Academy Award for the 1990 film "Dances With Wolves," which won the Oscar for best picture.
